Tech Communities, People, Fear, and Hope - Gareth Lloyd - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
---

In this powerful lightning talk from ACCU 2025, Gareth Lloyd explores the emotional landscape of tech communities—delving into fear, unconscious bias, identity, and the transformative potential of empathy.

Tech communities thrive not just on shared programming knowledge but also on emotional intelligence, inclusivity, and mutual understanding. Gareth reflects on how our fear responses—often triggered by unconscious bias or cognitive dissonance—can challenge our interactions within diverse and inclusive programming cultures. Drawing from both personal experience and broader social context, he unpacks how “false positives” in our fear response, sometimes driven by the so-called lizard brain, affect our perception of others in community spaces.
